metadata.Title: CVE-2012-1148 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the poolGrow function in expat/lib/xmlparse.c in expatbefore 2.1.0 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial ofservice (memory consumption) via a large number of crafted XML files thatcause improperly-handled reallocation failures when expanding entities.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-1148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.1.0-1
libexpat1 - 2.1.0-1
No subscription required

libxmlrpc-c++8v5 - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
libxmlrpc-core-c3 - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
xmlrpc-api-utils - 1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6
No subscription required

xotcl - 1.6.5-1.2
xotcl-shells - 1.6.5-1.2
No subscription required

tla - 1.3.5+dfsg-15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-1').
xmlrpc-c package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.16.33-3.1ubuntu6').
xotcl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-1.2').
tla package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.5+dfsg-15').
swish-e package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
cadaver package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
libxmltok package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
